comment.author: 59356674@N05
comment._content: Yes, Yao, from the Lake Nyasa area

comment.author: 60650251@N08
comment._content: Yes Yao. Chief Mpawa most likely from the Magomero area Chiradzulu. The Chieftancy still exists to this day.

comment.author: 60406173@N04
comment._content: The original homeland of the Yao was in what is now northwestern Mozambique, their name supposedly being derived from a hill of the same name in their territory.  They were important agents in trade between the interior and the coast.  For a variety of reasons, both internal (e.g. factionalism) and external (e.g. Angoni moving southward from near Lake Tanganyika) a migration took place in the mid-19th century into the area southeast and around the south end of Lake Malawi.  Association with Arab traders led to the adoption of Islam and involvement in the slave trade.
